summary: This document is a JPMorgan Chase durable power of attorney form for Jeffrey E. Epstein's accounts, authorizing Ghislaine Maxwell and Harry I. Beller as attorneys-in-fact with broad financial authority. It details the extensive powers granted to manage Epstein's banking, brokerage, and investment accounts. This document is a JPMorgan Private Bank 'Durable Power of Attorney' form granting broad financial authority over Jeffrey E. Epstein's accounts to designated attorneys-in-fact. It details extensive powers including banking, brokerage, investment management, and borrowing. The document is notarized by Harry I. Seller. This document is a collection of JPMorgan Chase account application forms and related documents for Jeffrey Epstein, including a Durable Power of Attorney form, a Morgan Premier Banking application, and a copy of a U.S. Virgin Islands driver's license. It shows Epstein establishing and authorizing access to financial accounts, with Ghislaine Maxwell named as a trustee.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Authorized as an agent (Attorney) to act on Epstein's behalf with full power over his financial accounts, as indicated in the specimen signature section.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: Authorized as an agent (Attorney) to act on Epstein's behalf and also appears as the notary public who notarized the document.

persons.name: Harry I. Seller
persons.context: Notary public for the State of New York who notarized the power of attorney document, with a commission expiring February 17.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: Primary account holder applying for JPMorgan Morgan Premier Banking services and granting a durable power of attorney.

connections.description: Epstein granted Maxwell durable power of attorney, authorizing her to manage his banking, brokerage, and investment accounts.
Epstein granted Beller durable power of attorney, authorizing him to manage his financial accounts; Beller also notarized the document.
Both were appointed as attorneys-in-fact (agents) for Epstein's accounts, potentially acting jointly or singly.
Seller notarized the legal power of attorney document executed by Epstein.
Epstein names Maxwell as a trustee on a trust account, indicating a formal financial and fiduciary relationship.
Beller, as a notary public, officially witnessed and notarized Epstein's Durable Power of Attorney document.

events.title: Account Application Submission
events.description: Date indicated on a form (likely the application submission date) for Jeffrey Epstein's JPMorgan account.

events.title: Power of Attorney Execution
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executed a Durable Power of Attorney for his JPMorgan account, granting authority to manage the account.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein executed a durable power of attorney granting Ghislaine Maxwell and Harry I. Beller extensive authority over his JPMorgan financial accounts.
The granted powers include opening/closing accounts, depositing/withdrawing funds, trading securities, borrowing money, pledging assets, and managing investments.
The document specifies that the power of attorney remains in effect even if Epstein becomes incapacitated, and continues until revocation or death.
The form is notarized by Harry I. Beller, who is also listed as an authorized attorney-in-fact.
The document is marked as a government exhibit (508) in case 20 Cr 330, indicating its use in legal proceedings.
Jeffrey E. Epstein executed a broad, durable power of attorney for his JPMorgan Private Bank accounts.
The power of attorney grants designated attorneys-in-fact extensive authority to manage banking, brokerage, investment, and borrowing transactions on Epstein's behalf.
The document was notarized by Harry I. Seller, a Notary Public for the State of New York, Rockland County.
The form specifies that the authority remains in effect even if Epstein becomes incapacitated, until formal revocation.
The document is part of the JPMorgan Chase records submitted in litigation (referenced by file numbers JPM-SDNY-00001845, etc.).
Jeffrey Epstein applied for a JPMorgan Chase 'Morgan Premier Banking' account, indicating a high-net-worth banking relationship.
A Durable Power of Attorney was established for Epstein's JPMorgan account, granting someone else authority to manage it.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a trustee on a trust account within Epstein's financial documents.
The document includes a copy of a U.S. Virgin Islands driver's license, linking Epstein to that jurisdiction.
The forms are marked 'Confidential Treatment Requested by JPMorgan Chase,' indicating their sensitive nature in subsequent legal proceedings.
